command: docker run --rm --net=host --cap-add=NET_ADMIN alpine sh -c "apk add --no-cache iptables >/dev/null && iptables -I INPUT -p tcp --dport 443 -m string --string 'covert-signal.example' --algo bm -j LOG --log-prefix 'T1205_TLS_SNI ' --log-level 4 && iptables -I INPUT -p tcp --dport 443 -m string --string 'covert-signal.example' --algo bm -m recent --name t1205_tls --set && iptables -I INPUT -p tcp --dport 8443 -m recent --name t1205_tls --rcheck --seconds 60 --reap -j ACCEPT"
explanation: Matches a TLS ClientHello/SNI host token 'covert-signal.example' on TCP/443 as the traffic signal. When seen, the host logs the event and temporarily opens TCP/8443 to the source IP, using application-layer TLS content as the trigger.
rationale_steps: Manipulate host iptables from a container using host networking.
Use string match on TLS/SNI bytes for an application-specific covert signal.
Record in recent list and allow 8443 for the signaled source for 60 seconds.
